description:
Self serving yogurt machines are a great way to challenge customers like us.  Anyone who comes by is capable of pushing a lever, up or down, to get a piece of frozen yogurt.  After couple days of experience, I realized what I've done didn't come out a perfect swirl.  I'm glad I never choose to work at Matcha Café Maiko.  Some of the staff there made lots of perfect green tea swirls.

Yoppi in the 2nd floor of Westfield is a perfect place to do-it-yourself for a bowl of froyo.  There's also fresh cuts of fruits and nuts to choose from.  All real flavors are of good quality, while froyos are tart.  I come to self serve vegan pineapple sorbet.  But what already caught my eye is an açai bowl.  Instead of self serving froyo, its better to tell a cashier to serve scoops of superfruit goodness, which cost little more than a self serving froyo.

If you ever happened to come and buy a frozen treat without using self serving yogurt machines, Yoppi in Westfield is perfectly good for açai.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
Very unimpressed with this Yoppi. Out of the 6 or so flavors, two (the classic tart and something else) were "out of stock," so, that was disappointing. No seats, so be prepared to take your yogurt down 2 flights to the ground floor if you want to sit while you eat.

Also for the amount I got, which was not much at all, my yogurt was crazy expensive. I could have gone to some bougie ice cream joint somewhere else in SF for better quality and selection for the same price.

I came here primarily because it was a convenient spot to meet with a friend, but I will most likely not come back.
author: Allie L.

description:
Yoppi's flavors are my favorite in SF. The tart flavors are perfect + I end up coming here 3 - 4 times a week. This may be a slight addiction..

Take my review with a grain of salt - I love tart + fruity flavors, but I haven't tried their others, like chocolate or cheesecake.
author: Scott Z.

description:
The yogurt here is pretty decent, I had the original tart flavor and it's about as good as what you would get from a Yogurtland kind of shop. There are also a good variety of toppings, ranging from raspberries and other fresh fruit, to mochi to syrups and candies.

The main drawback though is that it's rather expensive. At around $.66 an ounce, it's quite a bit pricier than other self-serve frozen yogurt places I've been to. That being said, if you have a mall badge you can get a 15% discount!
author: Tyler T.

description: Got the salted caramel pretzel & the honey. Both were good! The cookie dough topping was good as well, better than at other places.
author: Rori V.

description: I love Yoppi Yogurt and get something almost every time I'm in Westfield Mall. My favorite combo is original tart yogurt with yogurt chips. Can't be beat!
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Standard frozen yogurt fare. 5 or 6 types of frozen yogurt, and all the toppings you could ever want. I came on a Monday afternoon and it wasn't busy - not sure what this looks like on the weekend.

And yes - there's no where to sit nearby. We went to the chairs in the movie theater just around the corner.
author: Neda S.

description:
Yummy but pricey. Nowhere to sit.
Peanut butter was creamuhlicous!

Stingy when you ask for sample cups and they only give you one. :(
author: Angela C.

description:
Vanilla froyo with fruity pebbles! The end (mic drop).

I mean occasionally, if I wanna go the "healthy" route, I'll add blueberries. If I have an extra sweet tooth, then baby gummy bears! Load em up! 

My go to spot for a light pick me up!
author: Eva O.

description:
Yum! I'm a fan.

I love Yoppi since its a la carte, so I can have just a little taste ($2 worth, or a few ounces) and not be forced to waste or consume a full cup :) The girls are sweet about it and never balk at my teeny tiny (credit card) order.

Love their vegan flavors, as well. Definitely try the pineapple or raspberry dole whips if they have them that day. I've been trying to lower my intake of meat, and these are so delicious and refreshing and great for meat eaters and vegans alike!
author: Jackie C.

description: Yoppi Yogurt is a self-serve frozen-yogurt chain, and this location in the Westfield mall is perfect for stopping by for a quick dessert! They change their flavors weekly, but my favorite from my last visit was actually just the plain tart. The yogurt is decently creamy and the toppings bar is plentiful--this is a great stop for a dessert after some shopping or simply on a hot day. There's no seating whatsoever, so just take your cup and take a stroll around the mall!
author: David K.

description:
I had an hour to burn before a shoot in the area. Being it a hot day I went into the mall in search of some froyo. The mall map tried to confuse me on location but with determination I found it! I was greeted by a pleasant woman behind the counter and was offered sample cups. They had custard made that day and against the advice of my health conscious brain I made a cup full. Their custard rivals my hometown's (birth place of frozen custard.) Creamy, light and smooth.

Delicious product, excellent customer service, equals happy customer!
author: Na'im B.

description: Cheap and tasty acai bowls! They have a make your own acai bowl which consists of scoops (your choice of how many) of acai sorbet. The make your own aspect of the topics is great as you get to control the ratio you want of fruit, granola, nut, coconut etc topping. Personally, I've always felt that acai bowls I get have way too much granola that it's sickeningly sweet. The bowl I made for myself was just perfect to my taste, plus it was pretty decently sized and only $7. For an acai bowl that's pretty affordable.
author: Crystal Y.

description: Yummy !! The service is great, friendly and welcoming! Fresh yogurt with a variety of flavors and toppings. They also have, Açaí! What more can you ask for? I work near the mall so I frequently stop by Yoppi for a tasty and healthy treat !
author: Jasmine M.

description: I'm addicted to their new Acai!! Best Acai in San Francisco! I can't believe it was only six months ago and I didn't even know what Acai was. I love to get it at Yoppi in the Westfield mall because I can add just what I want.  It's better than Cafe Basik (although, I'll go there in a pinch). The thing I love about Yoppi is that I can choose blended or scooped ( I like the texture of scooped, seems to take longer to eat and it's harder) and then I choose which toppings and how much so I'm left with toppings to the last bite!!! They have all the healthy toppings I like,  but if I want a bit of a treat I can add a few pieces of the cheesecake squares or some toffee chips with my almonds. The chopped peanuts and kiwi are the best. Eat... ahhhhh!  I only wish they delivered!   Yum!!
author: Robin K.

description:
The sample monitor man here must get paid a ton because he was really on top of regulating that ish. 

They def foiled my plan of sampling until I was pretty much full when the guy walked away with all the sample cups in hand after my second sampling. Hrmph. Fine. I guess I'll go legit and pay for what I eat (only I didn't and instead Abby S was nice enough to foot the fro-yo bill for everyone), if you insist.

The joint is about the size of a nice, upper-middle class walk in closet so they only offer 6 flavors, but you can vote on their next 'seasonal' flavor on their magnet board in front. I didn't see anywhere to get a magnet dot to place my vote so I just mashed my hands on the board and moved like 30 of them off of one flavor I didn't like to the one I know should be the winner. I'd maybe feel if I didn't feel like everyone does the same thing. 

I ended up trying all 6 of the flavors and they were just fine, but my trough of fro-yo ended up being mostly chocolate-y, rich and non-fruit flavors until I got to the toppings where I loaded on both types of bursting boba (my favorite!!) and lychee (also my favorite). 

The yogurt hit the spot after a gluttonous crab dinner/smorgasbord with friends. The flavors were pretty standard, nothing really stand out-y or too crazy, but the price for 3 pretty decent mounds of fro yo for 3 growing girls was around $11, which is way cheaper than any of the fro-yo places I've been to before.
author: Candice G.

description: This place has more creative flavors than Pinkberry such as taro, birthday cake, etc.  I also have to say that this place is far superior to Pinkberry in the fact that it's self-serve.  I have control issues and I want to mix and play with froyo flavors and don't want to be limited to just four toppings to my froyo.
author: Bailey N.

description:
Omg... First time I saw the Irish mint flavored froyo at this yoppi, and I think I'm in love with it! Just so minty and the right amount of sweetness. Personally I'm not even a fan of mint ice cream, and this Irish mint froyo blew my mind away when I sampled it. Had to, it was just a command in my brain to, get a cupful full of Irish mint and cookies and cream froyo even though I was planning to save my binge day for the weekend, but that didn't happen and it was all worth it(: 

I will recommend these flavors, Irish mint and cookies and cream, mixed together for you with the toppings of almonds, dark chocolate chips, waffle pieces and oreo crumbs!!!
author: Wendy T.

description:
Wait - is this de ja vu? Yes, I just reviewed two other Yoppi Yogurts. Let's just say, I get around.

Unfortunately, while this one was heavy on the kiddos, it was lacking in samples, interesting toppings, and good flavors.

Fro-yo Fail. Sloppy Yoppi.

Boo/Nay/Negative (I must be feeling Negative Nancy today):
-Sample police - Why are you controlling the samples? Maybe it is because the mass number of children here.
-Not interesting flavors - Yoppi in general is due for some more machines. I like my choices!
-Quality didn't taste as creamy as other Yoppi locations
-Cramped - tiny location...did I mention it was filled with children?
-Topping choices are meh. 

Sampled. Left. Went to other Yoppi location. The End.
author: Libby J.

description: Small but good yogurts..no place to sit though.. Have to use the food court seating on 1st floor for seating
author: Pranjali S.

description: I chose the signature tart(?), and I like it very much, with peanuts, strawberries, cheesecakes and Nutella. I like the way how toppings were added by myself.
author: 蕾蕾

description:
Was looking for this place inside the food court but it's on the second floor of the mall as the sign at the entrance says :-D

The yogurt flavors of the moment were: plain Yoppi, mango, cheesecake, chocolate, vanilla, tangerine sorbet and maybe another one I forgot.

We asked to have samples, the girl at the register was very friendly.
I ended up getting a mix of cheesecake and mango (it's white not orange, like in other places). 

For the toppings, there is A LOT to choose from: mandarin oranges, strawberries, mango, pineapple, Reese's, cookie dough, chopped almonds and other nuts, mochi, brownie pieces, chocolate chips, different cereals, gummy bears and syrups: chocolate, peanut butter, caramel...
The cookie dough was yummy!

Didn't wanna go too crazy with yogurt and toppings, I probably had about 1 cup or a little more and it ended up being 8$ for 2 people! Not bad at all.

I love that everything, yogurt and toppings are self-served!! So much better like this.
Will come back if I'm in the area.
author: Leslie S.

description: It's froyo at the mall but it's actually really good. Their tart flavors are always on point (e.g., original tart, peach tart, lychee tart, etc). Recently I tried their honey and kind of loved it. Great selection of toppings, from fresh fruit to the trendy things like popping boba. It's pricey at $0.45/ounce, but if you're like me, you're only getting a small cup to tide you over as you wait for your significant other finish their shopping.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
I hate to admit it, but I may be losing my loving feeling for Yoppi. I can't tell if it's because the Westfield location is just too small a space to make the product enjoyable or maybe it's because I've been cheating on Yoppi. Yes, I admit it. Ever since Pinkberry and Sogreen rolled into town, I've been conveniently forgetting about Yoppi as a go-to froyo resource. Honestly the only reason Jamie W. and I came here the other night was because we just happen to be in the mall and wanted something sweet to spoon in our mouths as we watched the light show under the dome. We looked at the flavors available and settled on the peanut butter (see photo).

It was alright, a bit on the drippy side like the machine was acting up or something but not the creamy sensation I remember tasting at the Montgomery Street location. Perhaps Yoppi was just having a bad day and just needs to go to the beauty parlor to fix itself up the next time we pass by. However, with so many other froyo shops around, we feel our devotion waning for Yoppi. It's probably how Hugh Hefner felt when he left one nondescript playmate for another and another and another. Just call me Hef, and at 45 cents per ounce, Yoppi is starting to feel like an aging playmate waiting for the newer, fresher model to come along. Just keeping it real in the fircely competitive world of froyo.

FROYO - 3 stars...my last froyo there just didn't thrill me like it did before
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...a small space in a big mall
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...not much to it, they weigh your cup and take your money
TOTAL - 3 stars...drippity-drip
author: Ed U.

description:
For a froyo place, this location lacked variety in its flavors. My sister was disappointed, but luckily for me, I typically like to just stick to the original tart and add in mochi and those mini boba balls. There were six flavors including original tart, lychee tart, vanilla, chocolate, and a couple others. I tried the original tart and the lychee tart. The lychee tart was really good. Perfect hint of lychee and a refreshing tartness to it.

In terms of toppings they had the usual mochi (regular, green tea, and strawberry), mini boba balls, syrups, crushed oreos, cookie dough, sprinkles, nuts, crushed candy bars, chocolate chips, etc. For about 2/3C of froyo and toppings, I paid about $3.50.

It's a nice option to have when you're craving something sweet but don't want anything super heavy like Ghiradelli's ice cream downstairs.
author: Leana L.

description: The one by Montgomery closed down and I miss it. Glad that I found another one that is not too far off. I recommend the cake batter. Hmmm, maybe I should not be so happy, I think I am on my way to add 5 pounds back.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Self serve frozen yogurt inside the shopping center.
$0.49 cent per oz. it can be expensive the more stuff you have inside your cup. The toppings are the one with the most weight. 
Not many selection of flavors of the frozen yogurt. There are 3 bars of each flavor, the middle bar is to mix flavor. I notice that there a section where you can pick which flavor you want for the following week or day which is cool so you dont get the same flavor all the time.
There are way more toppings then then the frozen yogurt flavors from mochi, cereal, real fruits, and so on. 
Other than that, i enjoy their frozen yogurt
author: Julie N.

description: Small selection of frozen yogurt (I think 6 flavors?), but the toppings are solid and the place is well kept. When I was there, the clerk was being very helpful to several customers who seemed new to the whole self-serve frozen yogurt thing.
author: Jesse C.

description: It took me a while to write because I was in shock, if you're black and you want free sample you will pay 25 cent!!!! but if you any other you will get free samples as more as you want!!! It's not nice to make such discrimination ugly, and I'm going to file a complaint to management. worker tried to apologize soon as I caught her!!! even write me a letter of course I have not read it disgusting place, I thought that san Francisco should be an open city for all colors and genders!!!! So if you are black and you want yogurt make sure 2 bring change!!! Sad!!!
author: Tigi W.

description: The shop is very popular. A friend highly recommended this shop. The environment is nice and the staff are so kind.They offer many kinds of frozen yogurt, such as strawberry, pumpkin pie, French vanilla, chocolate and so on. You can choose whatever you want. And you can add fruit, candies, nuts and many other things on the frozen yogurt. It tastes so good. It really deserves a try.
author: Nancy S.

description:
Passed by this place while shopping at the mall, and it was fairly busy. But the manager or maybe owner? was nice enough to acknowledge me and offer me a sample, while cleaning up the yogurt machines.

 It's not a very large FROYO joint, but they have several different flavors and topping options. It's a self-service location and charges $0.45 p/ounce.

I sampled the Original and I would say it was fairly yummy. I wasn't in the mood for Froyo since i was still FULL from my lunch earlier, but I would have ordered from here.
author: Mary Y.

description:
Yoppi is so good! I went there and got a few cups with my gf.  Staff was definitely helpful and pointed us to some good flavors.  Like ice cream without the guilt.  Ill definitely be coming back here.  

Tell them jasper sent
author: Jas L.

description: Oh, frozen yogurt establishment in the mall, how glad I am to see that you've maintained your existence throughout the years! A perfect spot for a refreshing, light snack amidst the ridiculousness that can be a typical mall shopping experience. A bit sweeter than I remembered (especially the vegan pineapple dole whip flavor?), but overall, fantastic. The peanut butter remains my favorite. I do with you had some sort of loyalty card, though, Yoppi!
author: Shendi X.

description: My 2 years old niece wanted to try frozen yogurt, three of us were assisted her in the store. However, a female staff doesn't like there were too many of us inside the store, but only buying one cup of frozen yogurt. She was blocking the entrance and yell " only the purchase customer can enter". wow, what a good business strategy.
author: ming w.

description:
Yoppi has a small little froyo store in Westfield shopping center.  Because it's so small, they have limited flavors and toppings and no seating.  It's definitely froyo to go.  They offer six different flavors which include original tart, vanilla, chocolate, blueberry, pomegranate, and yellow cake batter.  I went with the original tart because it's sort of my litmus test for all froyo joints, plus it's one of my favorite flavors.  Yoppi's froyo plus toppings are priced at 45 cents an ounce, making them a bit more expensive than the rest of their self-serve competition (typically 39 cents/ounce).

My first reaction to Yoppi's froyo is that it's very icy.  It's a personal preference, but it's too icy for me.  Tartness flavor was okay.  They do have some toppings I haven't seen anywhere else.  These include their "boba poppers" and different flavors of mochi.  The boba poppers are small soft balls that contain flavored liquid inside.  I tried their mango and yogurt boba poppers.  The mango (orange) boba poppers remind me of salmon roe you can get at sushi restaurants!  I also tried their multicolored mochi.  Pretty cool.  Check out my photos to see the boba poppers and rainbow-colored mochi.
author: Daniel B.

description:
Only 6 flavors. Really stingy. Only one sample per customer. Crappy customer service. Creamy yogurt but limited flavors.
Only eat here if you are craving froyo and there is nowhere else open.
author: Gabriela G.

description: Self serve froyo with lots of exciting flavors. The pricing is on the slightly higher side, but the flavors were good. Conveniently located near Market and is healthier option compared to ice cream.
author: Christina N.

description:
Big fan of froyo and I'm addicting to this place. The froyo has a good rich thickness to it with lots of optional topping!! I had a original yoppi tart and add mango Mochi, mango, whip cream, and yogurt chip for only $3.35!
Which I love to makes crazy theme froyo so I called it "mango madness"

Overall good customer service and its worth it
author: Cindy G.

description:
I saw a sign in this store that said it was "best in the bay"

My gosh, it was. 

When my friends and I finally found this place, (we kept walking around the mall for like 20 minutes trying to find it) we were skeptical to buy from it because it was really expensive. 49 cents an ounce. And at yogurt land it's 29 cents. So we contemplated for a while and then finally gave in because we really wanted some frozen yogurt

I wish I took a picture of the yogurt I bought but it was just too good to wait. 
One of the rarest things at the froyo places I go to is whipped cream but this place had it and it was homemade! It tasted so good with the thick and rich yogurt. I have to admit, the yogurt was nothing like I ever tasted before in my life. It was that good. The fruit they had was really fresh too and the honey drizzle added sweetness to the tart yogurt flavors I chose. 
I didn't want to pay too much for it, so I got a little (only paid $3.52) but now I regret it and am dying to go back there gain.
Give this place a try!
author: Constance S.

description:
Overall, it is just like any other yogurt place.. that serves only 4 flavors at a time. It's definitely hit & miss with the flavors, in terms of consistency and richness of flavor. 

I really liked the plain tart and mango. Not overly tart-y or overly sweet. The chocolate and vanilla on the other hand, were SUPER RUNNY, similar to the low quality, melted "ice cream" at Asian buffets. That's the worst kind of "frozen" yogurt :( 

The entire place is pretty cute. It's very small with no seating area. 

One question though... where is the pricing info?? Maybe I just missed it, but there was no board or sign or any indication of how much it costs per ounce!
author: Samantha C.

description:
This is a cramped, but convenient Yoppi Yogurt location in the Westfield Mall. It's right across from Cotton On!

It's 45 cents/ounce. It's always pretty crowded in here, and you have to ask behind the counter for a sample cup. It feels like there are less toppings offered here, but I can't confirm that. There's no where to sit inside or anywhere nearby (which is strange for a mall). 

I prefer other locations of Yoppi Yogurt, but the location inside the mall does have it's advantages.
author: Rebecca G.

description:
I go to school near by and I really like the Caramel cream flavor!! =)

Workers are kind and always willing to let me try samples before I choose a fro yo flavor 

: )
author: Leeann C.

description: lots of toppings to choose from. Decent price for the amount you get! Self serve and you just pay at the till after weighing. It was super delicious!
author: LadyBlaze T.

description: So fresh and yummy! They have a great selection of fresh fruit and other toppings. They also have different flavours of yogurt each week but my fav is always the classic chocolate!
author: Rita A.

description:
I stopped by here with a friend to grab something sweet. 

There isn't much to say about this place. It's a typical froyo place. Quite pretty though. I like that they have a voting option for future flavors and I love that they have tons of topping options for you. The service is usually pretty nice too.

I haven't had a problem with their froyo since I've tried it. My friend and I got a mix of pumpkin flavor and cake batter. I covered with various toppings but the total came out to be a little under $3. This was way cheaper than I was expecting. 

Overall, good place. One of the better froyo places in my opinion but that might be because of my bias towards tons of toppings.
author: Sofia R.

description: One of my fav frozen yogurt place. Such a convenient location inside the mall. Their flavors are always changing which i like. I like the lime and green apple flavors because its so refreshing. The classic is always good too!
author: Anudari K.

description:
As far as froyo places go, Yoppi Yogurt is just as good as any other place, but the thing that really makes them special is their bursting boba. Despite having some initial reservations about putting something that resembles fish eggs on top of my froyo, I'm happy to report that they are super yummy and ridiculously fun to eat. 

For my next trip to Yoppi, I'm filling up my cup with the tart original yogurt, adding some fresh mango, and then finishing it off with a heaping (like, seriously ginormous) mound of lychee and mango bursting boba. I suggest you do the same.

One star off due to the fact that the fruit was fresh, but could have been fresher and more nicely cut/presented.
author: Anna L.

description:
This place blowsssss. 

I was craving froyo while shopping at Westfield with my cousin. The place was a MESS. Melted froyo everywhere, a random box of Kleenex laying around, and used sample cups littered the place. 

I forgot the flavors I got but I remember all the toppings looking like they haven't been refilled in DAYS. There was only one depressed looking girl working there clearly not doing her job. 

Just another shitty place to add to the list of places never to eat again in Westfield.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
I love froyo! I love Yoppi!

I can consume so much original tart froyo, no joke. I come here at least 1-2 times week, it's that good! I can live off froyo if I had to, for real. Lol. 

I'm not a fan of flavored froyo, that's what ice cream is for! But I do love my tart. They do have a lot of toppings though I hate the twisting dispensers! One time, I turned the knob and got more than I want but it was ok. I never been to a froyo spot that had chocolate covered raisins so it was something new and actually good. 

This location spot is pretty random, wish it were in the concourse of Westfield or a freestanding store on Market street. Usually when people ask me if I know any froyo spots nearby, I always direct them to Yoppi.

Yoppi DOES have a frequent customer program. You just have to always tell them your phone number. They print you a copy receipt of all the times you've visited and how much you've paid. Once you've hit $50, you get free froyo! They don't really advertise this, I didn't know of it until my friend told me when she worked near a Yoppi.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Tastes almost exactly if not a touch less tart than Tuttimelon but that's where the resemblance ends.

I hate buy by the pound places. For one, they're usually more expensive and they never seem to have fresh fruit. This one is no different.

Four plus dollars for two inches of Fro-Yo? Um, I think not.
author: Meg T.

description:
I think this place either went downhill, or their Carmel Cream flavor (mentioned in my previous review) was the only good flavor they had.   

I went back and was sad to see that they no longer had carmel cream.  The others flavors are okay, nothing special.

:(
author: Juliana K.

description:
I think this place deserves 3.5 stars, but I went for the 4 on yelp so it is so conveniently located inside the Westfield mall, on the 3rd floor by Aveda. 
I like the tart flavors, not too sweet but not too sour either. Although the flavor selections are pretty limited. The main reason I come to this fro-yo place is for its toppings. Along with different nuts, they have a good selection of fresh fruits, from kiwi to strawberry to mango to pineapples. I love that they have mochi (a must for me) too!
author: Nancy Z.

description:
best frozen yogurt in the city.

90% of froyo places have yogurt ALREADY MELTED/MELTY coming out of the machine, that turns into yogurt soup quickly, (weak sauce!), but at the market street yoppi, it holds shape and its cold temperature for the longest time.

you want a froyo you can almost CHEW, that's how cold it is.

i don't know why their machines are so much better than every other yogurt place, but it actually provides COLD yogurt consistently *knock on wood*.  not limp sauce.

the workers there always have the fruit bins filled with a variety of fruit & never lacking in the sauces either.
author: Samantha W.

description:
Froyoflation.

4: http://www.yelp.com/biz/yoppi-yogurt-san-francisco-2#hrid:Afu3itOiHxlFk23O-9TQCw
3: http://www.yelp.com/biz/yoppi-yogurt-san-francisco-6#hrid:vkreGqYHb3AFFayFXovdaQ
2: http://www.yelp.com/biz/yoppi-yogurt-san-francisco-5#hrid:3_lz2kV23R_cHYvZQKJaMw

Stars are moving in the wrong direction.

Cookies and cream is still declious.

Kind of embarrassed I paid $3.65 for 8oz.

Am I the froyo 1%?

Going forward Dreyer's will Occupy my freezer.
author: Jason B.

description:
ive had frozen yogurt all over the country and for the most part it all taste the same. What it boils down to is customer service and clearly this place is lacking it.

on sunday we walked into the tiny crowded store and ask for samples, the cashier seemed very annoyed, she says "get out the way, il make it for you". She comes out makes us one sample cup for 3 people (I guess we are all suppose to share one tiny sample). Then she runs to get behind her counter. From there she proceeds to bark "you people need to push the handles all the way up!". That was enough rudeness to ruin my appetite; needless to say I walked out of the place and will never be back! Im a grown adult, I can make my own samples, trust me ive done it a million times and its YOUR job to come out and push the handles up!
author: V I P.

description:
How many tubes of frozen yogurt can you eat in one week? I don't think it's wise to admit how many I had, but needless to say I made the most of it during my one week in San Francisco.

The only problem (well a problem for a little oink oink like me) was that the servings were charged by weight, so of course in my head that meant "unlimited!" Of course it isn't and although the smallest pot was the size of a babies head, I still played Krypton Factor and tried to cram as much as I could in (not that I needed to.)

It's a self-service so I was thrilled that I could try the mango tart, cheesecake, French vanilla, chocolate (just a tad, didn't much like it), strawberry and caramel. Sounds good so far right, but the next step is where it all goes wrong, because this was the, "stacks of crap" stage! My destroy your teeth selection included half a ton of gummy bears, M&M's, jelly sour worm things, cheesecake bits, cookie dough crumbs, brownie bites and a few pieces of fruit to make myself feel better. 


Mmmmmm! I miss you. xx
author: Josephine B.

description:
As long as froyo-judging goes, I always start with tasting the original tart flavor. Yoppi's original wasn't bad, but wasn't good enough to be memorable. It had what I think is the most common weakness across most froyo places: a little too watery. 

I did like the different mochi flavors and the big chunks of mango at the toppings bar.

I'm sure this store gets good business thanks to it's prime location (Westfield Downtown SF). I like having a froyo option when I'm shopping, although it would be nicer if the store wasn't so tiny.
author: Cherry H.

description:
There aren't many good frozen yogurt joints in the civic center area so I walked down Market from UN Plaza with a couple of friends just for Yoppi. The sample cups are always in a different place every single time I come here, this time I had to ask because it was between the wall and the cash register. I tried the pink grapefruit tart and it was stellar. I threw the sample cup away and asked for a new one to be courteous and hygienic. I also did the girl working a favor by pushing up the handles on every machine for her (I don't like my froyo all melted)! At $.45/oz, I value every bite of my frozen creation. The Irish mint was not up to my code and the original tart tasted like Yogurtland's original tart. So it makes sense that I dispensed mostly pink grapefruit tart and a little bit of original. 

I ran for the mango and green tea mochi before anyone else would dig in and ruin it. The green tea mochi was suprisingly easy to scoop and was not sticky at all. The mango mochi, however, was clumped together. I forgot to ask if the popping balls were from Taiwan (darn, hopefully I don't get poisoned) but I only like yogurt-filled balls since the other popping ball flavors are way too sweet and unhealthy. 

The variety of fruits is great but the strawberries and blackberries looked disgusting and I had to call the girl out to replenish with fresh pieces that don't look like spit. I'm getting my berry mojo on now with everything: strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, and blackberries. Lastly, I can't forget the crushed graham cracker to top it all off. The total was $5.58 but it all goes into my frequent dining points so only so much closer to $50.
author: Dominic T.

description: Had my first bobba here. Mango flavored and terrific with the classic chocolate fro yo
author: Lara H.

description:
I can't help but get Yoppi several times a week, it's so yummy. I wish they had Irish Mint more frequently, but it's okay because the other flavors are usually really good. I've fallen in love with the Cookies & Cream flavor because even though it doesn't taste like actual Cookies & Cream (to me, at least) it has this indescribably delicious flavor that I can't resist! Not a huge fan of their toppings, they could use more variety in fruits, but they've always got Almond Roca topping and I can't hate that!!!

I've eaten so much Yoppi in my short life time. Mainly because they give a mall discount. Gotta love that discount.
author: Ariele M.

description:
My hunt for the best frozen treat in San Francisco took me to Yoppi. It's a DIY affair so I piled my cup with a combination of flavours (chocolate, caramel and original "tart"), bypassing the toppings station to keep my fro-yo pure. Next, my cup was weighed and the guy behind the register joked "that will be a total of $3.26, if you feel like paying". I laughed and asked if there was an option not to,to which of course he said "Well, you could not pay but then I'd have to chase you down in the mall and I guarantee my legs are longer than yours". It put a smile on my face, as did my cup of frozen awesomeness which lasted all of about 6 minutes.

I really like that you can "vote" for the flavours that will be featured next week. Take a green sticker off the wall and put it next to the flavour that really takes your fancy. The flavour with the most votes then gets put in the machines the next week.
author: Tresna L.

description:
Why don't we have these in London? You would not believe my excitement at seeing this place!

So you pick your tub - small or large - and I'm telling you, the small is HUGE!! The small size tub is the equivalent of a large tub in London. You wander along all the different flavours of froyo and dispense however much you want into your tub. I was excited so I had a few - French vanilla, cheesecake, strawberry and caramel.

You then choose your toppings - now, I can't name everything that was there because there was SO much but as I was still excited (even more so in fact) I had lots - cookie dough, brownie bites, strawberries, strawberry boba, mango, sour jelly worms, gummy bears, mini M&Ms, Reece's Pieces... and a few others. What? Don't look at me like that, I'm on holiday! Anyway, I skipped thousands of others so I'd say that was good self control. You can also have sauces but my tub was looking a bit mental and I didn't want to then throw in a load of other confused flavours so I held back.

Next, you go to the counter where they weigh your pot and charge you. So for this humungous pot guess how much they charged... guess! $5!! Can you believe it? Cheap as chips! Then you grab a spoon and go! Simples!

The staff were a bit dull and lifeless to the point of moody but who cares? For all of this froyo deliciousness I'm really not bothered about their attitude!

Five stars! Come open a joint in London (and charge San Fran prices!)
author: Katie B.

description: One of my favorite places to get frozen yogurt. This place is cheaper than most froyo places in SF and the quality is also the best. I recommend the cheesecake topping! All of the flavors are pretty good.
author: Trisha L.

description:
Shopping with my mom and all of a sudden she said she wanted fro-yo so we were walking over to the new mall to cut through bloomingdales when I spot this place! Not wanting to go outside to the cold and wanting to try something new we decided to walk into this little shop.

They had 3 machines offering 6 flavors. Self-serve, my favorite. I grab a cup and went at it with the tart machine. Sadly, there isn't that many flavors to choose from and the toppings although limited and was in a need of restocking offered interesting toppings of fruits and these little balls filled with juice and my favorite mochi in multiple favors. 

Only one person working. 

The yogurt was good but the mochi was a bit tough.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Extra star for the nice employees/especially that one guy (Will is his name...I think?) who told me about their top-secret (not really, just it seems like it's on the dl rewards program; ask/complain [nicely] about [why/if] they havn't told you about it)
 
and as for being on the more expensive end...while I still think that's true, it is conveniently located...in a tourist trap (and it's sf on top of that) so what would you expect=X
author: G L.

description: My favorite flavors were cream caramel & red velvet; authentic flavors, thick smooth & creamy texture, and definitely on the sweeter taste. At 45 cents per ounce it's not cheap, but average given the location. Friendly service and I like that you can see them prepping the fresh fruit toppings. Everything looked very fresh. Chipper service.
author: Debora L.

description:
Chong and I have our conversations revolve around this f&&&ing place TO THE POINT where we make plans to meet up just because we're so stoked about "next weeks flavors" coming to fruition. 

Every week they have a great assortment of flavors to cater to tart & fruit lovers as well as flavors for the sweet tooth and the best part is these flavors are far from conventional. 

For sweet tooths they always have Yellow Cake Batter (perfect for the various toppings they have) and double chocolate, caramel cream

For tart lovers they usually have mango tart, green apple tart, original tart, passion acai berry tart.

To the right is an adorable board showcasing possible flavors for next week and magnets you manipulate towards the flavors you do want. For future flavors they listed TARO, LYCHEE (THOSE HAVE MY VOTE FOR SURE) PEANUT BUTTER, COFFEE CREAM, TOFFEE CRUNCH

I'm used to all the frozen yogurt places only having 4 flavors, usually the only 4 I don't want. I'm also used to frozen yogurt places having a lacking selection of toppings, another feat Yoppi nails in between the eyes. 

Toppings are ridiculous! There's a million ranging from assorted flavors of mochi (like green tea, strawberry and mango), lychee fruits, berries, kiwis, shredded coconut, the whole cereal aisle from safeway, cheesecake bites, brownie bites, cookie dough bites, nuts, granola, the whole candy aisle in safeway etc. 

My only complaint is this Yoppis never fails to aggravate my claustrophobia. These two gigantic amazons were giving me and chong such dirty looks implying we needed to hurry up and kept trying to squeeze in between us. Who practices such bad manners? we would never do that to anyone no matter how long they were taking. That's beside the point anyway since we weren't taking long at all. I ended up dumping way more toppings than I wanted because glamazon next to me was giving me Death from Snoo Snoo (futurama reference) threats. This caused me to mercilessly drop so many toppings far from their respective containers. YOPPIS DESERVES A BIGGER AND BETTER LOCATION IN THE MALL.
author: Myrtle M.

description: Really good flavors I like it very much healthy food recommend you guys. Great service I will come back soon. Thank you
author: Alfre A.

description:
I love frozen yogurt and this place hits the spot when I get a craving while shopping downtown. The convenience of it being inside the mall is great but it was a little cramped in there because it's such a tiny location. Aside from that, no complaints. The price was actually reasonable for the amount that I got. I thought it would be higher since it's inside a mall. 

There are tons of topping to choose from, with most of it being sweets such as bursting jelly filled pearls, various flavors of mochi (mango, original, and more), fruits (wish it were fresh fruit but most of it was in syrup), candies, nuts, cheesecake, brownie bits, waffle bits, and much more. The frozen yogurt is creamy and I like that it isn't too melty. I hate when my froyo turns into soup immediately after I pay. I got the pomegranate tart and original tart and both were good. They were sweet with a subtle but distinctive tart flavor. It's sweeter than the Pinkberry original tart. My friend got the cake batter flavor and he enjoyed it too. 

All the stations are clean and they accept credit cards with no minimum charge.
author: Nancy C.

description:
Great place to go if you want something cold and refreshing for a snack.

It is $0.45/oz and they have about 6-8 flavors available per day. I'm more used to the "Asian" or fruit flavors (taro, mango, honeydew) but this place serves more Americanized flavors that are too sweet for my taste. I'm usually stuck with one or two flavors. I rather go to Tuttimelon or Pinkberry.
author: Joanna W.

description: I am undecided between 2 and 3 stars as the shop has a limited selection due to its size plus the strawberries were not too fresh. I guess you better try a different topi store, the frozen yogurt is a delicious idea.
author: Thomas P.

description:
I LOVE THE YOGURT HERE!!! Gahh...Ive been having it a lot lately...which is not good! The yogurts tendency is just right, not too wateryy...its thick thick if you know what I mean...They have various flavors, not just your ordinary FRUIT flavors...its just AWESOME!! :) 

Its in a MALL duhh...they have wifi! :P
author: Jennifer B.

description: It is inside the mall, so it's super convenient for me to have some yogurt between classes. They have a lot of toppings, and the cheesecake flavor is so creamy. Mix it with chocolate, it's heaven. Also the yogurt at this location is put at right temperature, so it's thick as well (Stonetown location failed on this). Favorite spot for dinner
author: Zisele N.

description:
I work in Union Sqaure so I have pass by this place a few times when I go into the mall to eat for lunch. I never tried it. I always got my frozen yogurt from Blondies. I came here a few weeks ago and now it's my go to place for frozen yogurt.

Yes the prices are high compared to other DIY yogurt places but like most people say that has to do with location.
author: Nava N.

description: Lately as it's slowly been warming up (lol), I've found myself craving frozen yogurt so I ended up wandering in here. It's definitely grown on me -- either that or the fruit section really did expand and I'm a happy camper. I definitely enjoy some the flavours that make a special appearance and I've found my "thing" which is a small amount of original, with lots of strawberries, kiwis, and a tiny bit of chocolate chips. Yum.
author: Shauna S.

description:
4th Yoppi review?!
Crazy fool.
Been having too much Yoppi lately. How can you not?
Cookies and Cream, Tart flavors, French Vanilla...argh!

Bring it on.
author: Nick L.

description:
1.Who cares if there's nowhere to sit there, there's umpteen number of benches in the mall to sit down on if you really want to.

2.Its nice how you can control your portion size. I personally like only a little bit to satisfy my craving...pay $1.50 to get it rather than $4 for a small somewhere else. Win.

3.Sure the flavors are limited, but honestly, how many times do you go to a yogurt or ice cream place and 80% of the flavors are rubbish that you arent the least bit interested in?
author: Ash S.

description:
!!!! Ask to be on their 'Frequent Customer System' !!!!

All you have to do is give them your phone # at check out and for every penny spent there will go towards your accrued balance. Once you reach $50, you will get a POUND of FREE FRO-YO!!
author: Keiko C.

description:
One of the two frozen yogurt places I like to go to, Yoppi's has yellow cake batter flavour!  Yum.  Topped with fruit and a bit of whipped topping, I was in heaven today.

I like their voting board for what new flavours you want to see next week.  (of course, I only seem to get the cake batter, but for those who want to try something new, cast your vote!)  Add your toppings of fresh fruit, sauces, chocolate bits and whatever strikes your fancy.  A lot of good options!

There's only about 5 or 6 flavours of frozen yogurt, but I find the range of toppings to make up for it (Capt Crunch?  Seriously??)

A great stop for a quick healthy snack.
author: Cassandra J.

description: This is my favorite frozen yogurt in the world.  Nothing else comes close.  I love the original tart flavor and some of the recurring fruit tart flavors.  Plenty of fresh fruit toppings and a bunch of the candy toppings.    This place is clean, fresh, and hits the spot.  And the people who work here are always friendly.  This is worth a trip.
author: Koa K.

description:
First of, it's so obvious that majority of the negative reviews are written by the jealous competitors!!! The folks, who are regulars, like myself, would never give a one star or even a three star, for that matter. 

This place serves great yogurt; it's in the great location ( I work across the street and take a quick run to the store to get the yogurt fix) and the lines moves very fast. If I wanted to sit down for a meal, I would just head downstairs to the food court and eat a meal. I love it that you can grab yogurt and continue on in the mall.

I highly recommend this place.
author: Andrew B.

description:
this yoppi  yogurt is in westfield mall. small little hole in the wall.

froyo availability:
-french vanilla: sweet
-blueberry tart :  blueberri.ness,  tartness
-signature tart
-classic chocolate
- yellow cake batter
-pomegrate tart : pom taste with tartness

pricing: self serve. .45 cents froyo & toppings. 9 fruit toppings, 3 yogurt poppers, 4 mochi, 2 crumbled cookies, 20ish dry toppings (nuts, chocolate, nuts, candies)  in silos and jars.

frodrips
-taylor dispensing machines, customized apo laminated cups
-froyo texture on soft side, creamy on edge of watery, not firm  (-.5)
-no seating on site nor anywheres near in mall                            (-.5)
-wacky wabbit wating: 2 stars, setup not kid friendly. no seating, pricey
author: Victor G.

description: Yoppi has very good frozen yogurt. That's really not the case at a lot of yogurt places, where the yogurt merely serves as a base on which to ladle toppings. It's nice to have this one available at the mall, but it has a lot fewer flavors and toppings available, and no space. There's usually some space that can be found in the mall, but it's still a bit of a pain.
author: Lisa K.

description:
My husband & I stopped in here for a late afternoon snack and I was pleased at their setup. 

They offer insane toppings from fresh fruit to candy to cereal as well as about 6 flavors to choose from. 

You also pay per 'ounce' of yogurt/toppings you pick so you don't end up paying a price for a 'cup size' without having it filled up. 

It is self-serve which should seem to make the line move faster but there are always some who like to move slow and put everything on their toppings. 

The fro yo was yummy and I loved the variety of toppings. Had to stop myself from trying to get everything on it.
author: Julia W.

description: I like how you can serve yourself and basically create your own frozen yogurt. There's a lot of toppings and the popping balls are pretty fun to eat. Their flavors changes every so often, but my favorite is the cake batter flavor. Do ask for a free sample cup if you're unsure of what flavors to try
author: Connie M.

description:
I can't stop thinking about Yoppi Yogurt! I wish they delivered. 

My favorite is the the cake batter yogurt with fresh fruit (a little of everything), the little tiny cheese cake squares, and then.... the mochi (insert angles singing).  

I LOVE how the mochis get a little firm when they freeze in the ice cream so that they are soft but chewy. 

YUM! YUM! YUM! 

I wish that they delivered! But it does give me an extra incentive to go to the Westfield Mall so I can get my Yoppi! Yoppi! YOPPI!! 

Yippy, Yippy, Yippy for Yoppi, Yoppi, Yoppi!!!!!!!

:) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :)
author: Robin k.

description:
My weakness is frozen deserts! I could literally eat endless amounts....

I really appreciate the selection of tart flavors! and the large selection of toppings, tons of fruit choices is a bonus, they go perfectly with some original tart flavor. Besides fruit there are some interesting sweet treats, sauces and some cereal options.. get creative, or throw some of everything in!

The price can quickly mount up if you get wild with the toppings but somethings are worth the money and for me froyo is one of those things! Go on get the big tub!!

Vote for next weeks flavors!!
author: Chris M.

description:
I absolutely love Frozen Yogurt, and to my disappointment that there aren't any Pink Berry or Red Mango's out here in San Francisco; but stumbled upon Yoppi Yogurt.

Small, quaint, but cute, so can be somewhat packed with people looking in every direction for what flavor or simply waiting for one to give up a self serve spot.  I tried their original tart, classic chocolate, and carmel, topped with graham cracker dust, orea bits, and maraschino cherries; it was delicious!  I was hoping to find Taro flavored frozen yogurt, but carmel did the crave; I wanted seconds of carmel - not so much of the original tart or classic chocolate (but was still good).

Really fixed my crave!
author: Alex C.

description:
I echo KH's review completely.

Where the yogurt is good - the customer service is disgusting.

I had the absolute WORST customer experience at this location. We just went there especially for your yogurt on Sunday 9 September at around 4.45 pm and the "manager" gave my sister and I the worst customer experience that I have ever been a part of. 

1. He blamed us for leaving the yogurt handles too low and very rudely asked us to pull them higher. He said we were "the last ones in line" when that clearly wasn't true and besides that it isn't our job to be monitoring his store. 

2. He had been texting the whole time that we were there not helping the other girl working at the time. When my sister asked for a sample he rushed over gave us one and resumed texting. So after I did his job fixing his yogurt machines. I mentioned to my sister that should be his job. He over heard and then said exactly. "Just take your fucking change and get out." 

He was so aggressive and hostile. First blaming us for something he is clearly responsible for. Then using expletives. I do not understand these people!
author: Simi D.

description:
I only got 2 flavors, cookies n' cream and vanilla. Wanted to try the passionfruit and Yoppi signature but both were not ready. Disappointed that they were so limited. For the toppings, I got cheesecake, my favorite, and strawberry mochi. It was 45 cents an ounce. WHAT THE. I'm glad that I didn't go all out like I would've at home, or else my wallet would've been screwed ... 

I wish the employee was more prepared with his flavors and didn't open 5 minutes late. Frozen yogurt was yummy but pricey. We were going to leave but "yay" for my obnoxious knocking.
author: Cathy N.

description: 45 cents for an ounce. I like how the dried toppings come from a long tube so that not many people can touch it with their bare hands.
author: Jboogie L.

description: I had time to kill, I was craving froyo and remembered I passed by this place before. I got the blueberry mixed with plain tart yogurt and a squirt of french vanilla! They had some weird balls filled with liquid, it was not worth it. Love the cereal selection, and the fruit looked fresh. it was yummy, no complaint.
author: Karen T.

description: OK flavors. This one isn't as good or doesn't have as many flavours as the one on Pine.
author: Vera W.

description:
Small little yogurt shop in the Bloomingdales side of the mall.  Perfect for a pop in and out when you're overheated from too much shopping.  We were here the day after Christmas and froyo totally hit the spot!

They don't have a large selection of flavors to choose from but they do have yellow cake batter.  It totally tasted like cake!  All of the other flavors are the regular vanilla and chocolate variety.  They have a huge selection of toppings though.  I found this yellow caviar ball looking thing with juice in the middle.  Very interesting...  It would be nice if their flavors matched their toppings in variety.

.45 a oz.  I really don't know if that's expensive.  I never check.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
more like yucky yogurt!

I went here, being the yogurt fanatic that I am, and the yogurt was unappetizing! It was waaaay too sweet ! The whole place itself was a bit too small and cramped.. The toppings were alright but this place really wasn't that good. I regret not trying the flavors first, than actually thinking that this place was going to be great. On top of all of that there are no chairs or anything! You have to walk around and eat! If I wanted to walk around at eat at the same time I'd eat something that doesn't require a utensil!

Yet again, mall yogurt is almost ALWAYS ... gross
author: Susie N.

description:
This place is alright...I'm a frozen yogurt afficionado, and while their yogurt isn't horrible, it's not that great either.  I love tart yogurt and theirs is pleasantly consumable but not outstanding.  I wasn't really impressed on either of the 2 occasions I went with their selection of flavors either.  I'd stop in again if I was having a fro yo craving attack and didn't have time to go to Tutti Melon up the street.

It was OK...I guess you could say I just wasn't that into it.
author: Laura L.

description:
This is my favorite Yoppi location. The staff is always friendly and its the only place I find Red Velvet. Its always clean and the condiments are always stocked.

My favorite Yoppi - start off with a little bit of tart, then yellow cake batter, then if they have it, RED VELVET (sooo good)....my toppings, green mochi, oreo cookies, cookie dough, and strawberries (so i don't feel so guilty)
author: Cnn F.

description:
The cake batter frozen yogurt was AHHHMAZING! I came here twice during my trip to the Bay area just for the cake batter frozen yogurt!

There was a good selection of other flavors, I also tried the chocolate and it was yummy as well. It's amazing that they can make something that's only 120 calories and 0 grams of fat for a cup taste like it's about triple the calories. Whatever, I'm not complaining!

The only drawback to the Westfield Shopping Center location is it's super tiny, so it can get a little bit cramped with everybody surveying the different flavors and adding their toppings. With that said, I would gladly brave the crowd anytime for more cake batter frozen yogurt. Mmmmm.
author: Jessica W.

description:
I don't really understand all the one-star reviews on here. This place has the best frozen yogurt around. Better than any of the other big yogurt chains that are popping up everywhere. 

I work at the mall, so I come here all the time. As for the "white girl" employee that someone wrote something nasty about -- she is great. She is there every time I come in and has always been very helpful. Maybe, you caught her on a bad day, but it sounds a bit dramatic to me. And I totally get them doing the samples for you. I have seen people make such a mess and totally take advantage when they let you do it yourself. After all, it's a mall, so there are lot's of teenagers trying to get free samples. Besides they grab the cups from the bottom, not putting their "dirty little hands" all over it, like that girl said.

True, sometimes the place is a bit messy, but it's understandable when it's so freaking popular! Don't come on a weekend around 3 if you're in a hurry. Line out the door! Or, if you love yogurt, do.
author: Ashley S.

description: Ah...pleasure without guilt seldom happens. The illusion of enjoying an ice cream gets you away from that dieting deprivation. The toughest part is the toppings: chocolates or fruits? All up to you! The location of this Froyo makes it convenient for those who are shopping or even just window shopping, 2nd floor inside Westfield Mall, San Francisco.
author: Lora M.

description: Carmel Cream. Wow. Went little overboard on how much I served myself but I am over it now. Such a decadent dessert for self serve item. I came back for another sample and the guy working at the cashier gave me one!
author: Gunter L.

description: Yoppi Yogurt is a must go to for delicious yogurt. I have been here about three times every time I come back to SF from the east coast. Even my bf from MA said he loves Yoppi more and it is better then the yogurt restaurants in MA. I definitely love the yogurt here. I went about a week ago before I left and I got the original with popping boboas and mochis. I love the popping boboas and mochis, they are so delicious with the yogurt. And the price is affordable. One thing I love about Yoppi is how the yogurt is not icy but creamy which yogurt is suppose to be made this way, not icy.
author: Ice T.

description: Came here on Monday during the lunch hour with the family and got a whole bunch of yogurt. We're a group of eight and I saw a mint flavor that I knew my husband would want to try. I asked my kids to look at the flavors and see if there was something that they wanted to try. As they looked I asked if we could sample. The person gave me one, one tiny sample cup. So I just got a bit of the mint and let everyone have a taste. The texture was good as well as the flavor so I just had my kids get whatever they wanted based on the mint. Wrong!! The original flavor was runny and the white peach was watery. What was good were the toppings however and they had a nice selection. I also thought it was cool that they have a savings program based on your phone number because I always forget the card. But I don't see myself coming too often since it wasn't fantastic and at .49 cents an ounce the costs can get pretty steep.
author: Annie P.

description: Convenient froyo spot in the mall. How can you go wrong with fresh fruit and your choice of toppings? Like, A LOT of toppings. I very much appreciated the Almond Roca bits topping. Thanks, Yoppi!
author: Felicia G.

description:
Definitely my favorite yogurt spot in SF, since pinkberry is only available inside Virgin America T2 at SFO, unless you drive to the South Bay. I rarely travel down that way so Yoppi is a great substitute.
They have a great choice of flavors, the selection is rather large. Unlike other froyo places the flavors actually taste like what they are suppose to. I would say red velvet and lychee are my favorite flavors. The original and mango is quite good as well. The chocolate tastes very creamy and chocolatey! I think the reason why I like the froyo here better is they taste very creamy, and doesn't taste like artificial flavorings. The texture is rich and consistent. The original is tart but not too sour, and tastes very much like Pinkberry. Besides these two establishments, I am not a fan of any other froyo places.
There's a huge selection in toppings too. They have mango and green tea flavored mochis on top of the original. Nom nom nom. 
It's cool how you can vote for the flavors you want the next week, but I saw some dumb girl rigging it by moving all the magnets from one flavor to another. Bleh! 
I always stop by whenever I am at the Westfield now. Can't wait for some lychee froyo yum!
author: Jenny W.

description: I really liked the original tart flavor and peach wasn't bad either.  Kind of reminded me of Pinkberry but more choices.  I'll definitely have to go back to try pomegranate:)
author: J K.

description: Blueberry tart was bomb. Red Velvet was gross. Toppings were great. The cashier even brought me the bag of waffle cones so I could grab some larger ones. Id love one of these in san jo! Downside is that I only bought a small size, I should have made a huge one. Yum Yum!
author: caneisha h.

description:
Love that Yoppi have fresh fruits and amazing toppings. Their cheesecake flavor frozen yogurt was by far the best flavor I ever tried! 
Only down side is that it is kind of pricier than usual frozen yogurt place, but overall love it!
author: Lisa B.

description: Much better and healthier than ice cream and you get more for your money here. Big huge cup filled with yogurt and toppings for under 3 bucks versus Dreyers 1 scoop in the smallest cup possible for 5 bucks. You decide where you wanna go. I'll stick to yoppi
author: Sophie P.

description: Great Self Serve Yogurt.. How can you not love it.. You make it!
author: Rix G.

description: Finally, a froyo place at the mall! Too bad it's overpriced. I literally filled a third of my standard "small" cup with plain yogurt and NO TOPPING and it came to $4.70! Now, if it hadn't tasted like diluted and skimmed yogurt, I would've found the satisfaction worth the money, but sadly, it was just icy and gave me bad breath and a headache.
author: Nicole L.

description:
i couldn't believe my brain, when i quietly snuck in here (not an employee or customer in sight...) to try their yellow cake batter flavor, and thought i was eating liquid cake. in its purest creamy form. 

good thing i was completely alone because it was a very uplifting and personal moment.
author: Jessica C.

description: Awesome!!! Its REAL FROZEN YOGURT! AND REAL FRUIT! When in doubt, go with the original flavor - Sweet and Tart at the same time & not overpowering when you add your toppings. It really hit the spot and I didn't feel guilty afterwards :-)
author: LaKeisha S.

description:
Horrible frozen yogurt!

I was shopping at the mall, and was really craving froyo when I encountered this joint.
 
45 cents/oz sounded absolutely insanee to me, but I was desperate! I got a little bit of the plain tart, and the toppings were just pathetic. They were half empty, messy, and overall unappetizing. The girl at the register seemed like she would rather be anywhere else. 

The yogurt pretty much tasted like ice. I felt like I was eating ice and chocolate chips. Horrible. How can they sell such crappy yogurt at such a high price? Gross.
author: Fatima H.

description: Im not a big fan of frozen yogurt and this place did not change my opinion. Camer here after realizing Bloem 'n Sugar was closed. Nothing special here that you couldnt get at nubi. 45 cents/ounce, there was only 6 flavors when we went there. Props for the variety of toppings. Fresh fruits, mochi, cereal, gummy bears, exploding boba and other stuff. The signature tart is probably the best flavor as their cookies n cream wasnt that great. Id pass on this place unless someone else was craving frozen yogurt.
author: Robert Y.

description: Perfect place to satisfy my sweet tooth. I love being able to control the portions of the yogurt and toppings - don't forget they charge by the ounce! I like that the consistency of the frozen yogurt here is creamy instead of icy, and their selection of flavors - although small - are always yummy. My faves include Irish Mint, Yellow Cake Batter, and Cookies n Cream. Their cereal dispensers and toppings bar have always been refilled and cleaned really well, so perhaps the negative reviews beforehand were taken during a really busy rush of customers.
author: Elaine W.

description: This is the only place I know that has the cake batter flavor. & it's sooo good! Also, YAY for the colored spoons! I would however appreciate a little more enthusiasm from the employees.
author: Tiffany P.

description: I stumbled upon this place while shopping at lunch one day and YUM! The price is great, selection great and friendly staff. Quick in and out, the way I like it! :) Will be back!
author: Gina H.

description: Two flavors out and very low on toppings. Finger prints and stickiness everywhere. The place was empty but it looked like a whrilwind of kids passed through here. An employee was standing around greeting but probably should have been cleaning. I enjoy the Yoppi on Fillmore and Montgomery better.
author: Sarah D.

description: The yogurt is fine (but the yellow cake batter is too much like the real thing and was pee colored).  The mochi here is ridiculous though -- yogurt flavored, strawberry, mixed, orange (i think), and ... cookie dough -- mochi?!  What?
author: Olivia L.

description: I didn't think I'd like this place since my frozen yogurt standards are pretty high ;) And it looked so random/small whenever I passed by it while shopping. I had also passed by the location on Filmore a couple times too (which is much more spacious and has more flavors available at a time). I've tried both now and weirdly I prefer this location so much more! I hate when my froyo is already starting to melt before I even get a taste; it's probably my biggest annoyance when it comes to frozen yogurt. (Emphasis on FROZEN). The Filmore location always has runny yogurt for some reason. Disappointing when I'm in that area and not close to here! But this one in the mall is always quiality! The original tart is delicious along with their flavored mochis and fresh fruit. I love that even by the time I'm finished the froyo is barely melted if even. A great (semi) healthy treat when you need a break from shopping.
author: Jenny C.

description: I came here on a Saturday afternoon with the boyfriend, which was probably the reason why the place was packed. We got the yellow cake batter froyo. It tasted like vanilla ,____,There were a lot of toppings available, but our favorite ones were the mochi and orange popping boba :) The guy who works there was super friendly and courteous. I'll definitely come back whenever I'm in the area and in need of a froyo fix.
author: Tiffany L.

description: So...I was in SF today with some friends and was looking for frozen yogurts places with high ratings.  The one that caught my eye was Yoppi Yogurt, mostly because my name is Yoppo and I found the similarity between the two names very amusing.  We decided to try it out at the Westfield mall, and it's quite delicious, thumbs up!
author: Yoppo C.

description: Love this place!  Friendly staff, and for under five bucks, you can get some damn good yogurt!  They have flavors in constant rotation...my favorite, you ask?  The Pink Grapefruit Tart blew my mind.  Lots of choices for toppings, like candy, cereal, fresh fruit, mochi, and more.  I opt for the fruit so I don't feel obese, but you can get whatever you want.  I won't judge you.
author: Tim F.

description:
love! was here the other day after my friend and i grabbed lunch, and he had a craving for something sweet.

they had multiple flavors (6) you can try before you buy and best part is you can mix them too (well i did)

and then a pretty good amount of toppings to choose from. they had fresh fruits (the mango was particularly yummy i think it is also in season..) and different color mochi, cheesecake crumbs, m&m, jelly beans, as well as more healthy stuff (for him) like almonds and nuts.

best part is they weigh it, so its based on how much you buy, regardless of the amount of flavors or toppings you mix..they don't limit you to three, so i tried a little of everything.

definitely going back.

cashier was friendly as well
author: Whitne Y.

description: Service is awful. Super stingy with the sample cups, when you ask someone a question they act like your bothering them, they put the finger on the scale when they weighed it, and expected a tip... NEVER GOING AGAIN!
author: Kashara W.

description:
I'm a big fan of Yoppi Yogurt. Most of their locations aren't open over the weekend. Finally, there is a place where I can go get yogurt  pretty much any day of the week. I love this cute store, fast, easy in & out, and not to mention choice of over 30 different toppings, plus Captain Crunch:) Their Blueberry tart and Pomegranate tart are absolutely to die for....
Did I mention comfy couches at Westfield mall? Yogurt and comfy couches, you goto try it.
author: J T.

description: Terrific yogurt in a sweet little shop.  Loved the original tart and the french vanilla.  Also the chocolate and the pomegranate and the mango - all the ones I've tried actually.  Esp. love the fresh fruit toppings and the great selection.  You can actually have a healthy snack here that is delicious.  The store is bright and clean and the staff has always been friendly and helpful.  A refreshing and energizing stop while shopping.
author: Robin R.

description:
is this place pronounced "yop-ee" or "yo-pee"?

plain tart is delicious. i like how you can vote for seasonal flavors. pomegranate and lychee tart are yummy. 45 cents/oz is a little pricey but it's self serve. i recently discovered how awesome cinnamon toast crunch is with tart. 

tipster: give the cashier your phone number and you can earn free froyo.
author: B Y.

description: this was yum! i got the yellow cake with some candy-covered almonds and almond roca and a small tasting of blueberry tart with cheesecake bits. the frozen yogurt had a nice flavor and there were many add-ins to choose from! i love that they have so many flavors that they switch out every week to new things and give you a sneak peak for the week to come.
author: Marjie T.

description: yeahhhhhhhhh. i am a fan. i like the fact that I can add my own toppings and sauce. I made the icecream according to my taste.
author: Kumar G.

description: I am a fanatic of yogurt and I loved this place! Wish this place was a little bigger and had chairs! Because the benches in the mall are always occupied!
author: Maria Armida T.

description: the yogurt flavor tasted artificial and over all flavor was too sugary, I think they should try buying the same quality mix that yogurtland uses, I guess they copied everything but the good yogurt part
author: stephen J.
